message.content:
{"id": "35156", 
"title": "Bug 35156: Ctrl+F1 not working on certain fields in the help search", 
"description": "When using Eclipse with a DBCS locale, pressing Ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the help search window does not display the expected help pop up screen. This issue occurs on all DBCS languages. However, when cycling through all the other fields using the tab key, pressing Ctrl+F1 functions properly and displays the correct text. An attachment has been provided to highlight the specific field that is not responding to Ctrl+F1.", 
"OB": "Pressing Ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the help search window when using Eclipse with a DBCS locale should display a help pop up screen.", 
"EB": "Pressing Ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the help search window when using Eclipse with a DBCS locale does not display the expected help pop up screen.", 
"SR": "To reproduce the issue: 
1. Launch Eclipse with a DBCS locale.
2. Select 'Search Help' from the menu bar.
3. When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press Ctrl+F1.

Expected Result: A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.

Actual Result: Nothing happens."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '35156', 'title': 'Bug 35156Ctrl+F1 works only on some fields in the help search', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'OS: LinuxGTKBuild: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRESteps to reproduce:1.Launch eclipse with DBCS locale.2.Select from the menu bar SearchHelp3.When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.Expected Result:A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.Execution result:Nothing HappensComments:1.This occurs on all DBCS languages.2.This event only happens in the first text field.When cycling through allthe other fields using the tab key, the ctrl+F1 functions properly bydisplaying the correct text.3.The attachment will show exactly which field is not responding to thectrl+F1, for it is circled in red.The fields circled in green work properly. ', 'SR': 'OS: LinuxGTKBuild: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRESteps to reproduce:1.Launch eclipse with DBCS locale.2.Select from the menu bar SearchHelp3.When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.Expected Result:A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.Execution result:Nothing HappensComments:1.This occurs on all DBCS languages.2.This event only happens in the first text field.When cycling through allthe other fields using the tab key, the ctrl+F1 functions properly bydisplaying the correct text.3.The attachment will show exactly which field is not responding to thectrl+F1, for it is circled in red.The fields circled in green work properly. '}
